content.question: In relation to the video “What Most Schools Don’t Teach,” the authors mention Jane Margolis’ “unease” (paragraph 3, sentence 1) primarily to

choices.label: provide supporting evidence for the video’s claims about the importance of perseverance in learning to code
demonstrate that the video creates false expectations regarding the financial rewards of careers in computer science
rebut the video’s premise about the steps required to make programming skills more widespread
suggest a more effective way to make programming seem appealing to those outside the computer science community

content.answer: rebut the video’s premise about the steps required to make programming skills more widespread

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain ways claims are qualified through modifiers, counterarguments, and alternative perspectives.
